startDate.desc: A JavaScript Date or Luxon DateTime object that passes in a starting display date for the calendar to display.

sundayFirstDayOfWeek.desc: If true this will force month and week calendars to start on a Sunday instead of the standard Monday.

calendarLocale.desc: A string setting the locale. We use the Luxon package for this. This will default to the user's system setting.

calendarTimezone.desc: Manually set the timezone for the calendar. Many strings can be passed in including UTC or any valid IANA zone.

eventRef.desc: Give the calendar component a custom name so that events triggered on the global event bus can be watched. If none given a random name will be assigned.

preventEventDetail.desc: Prevent the default event detail popup from appearing when an event is clicked in a calendar.

allowEditing.desc: Allows for individual events to be edited.

renderHtml.desc: Event descriptions render HTML tags and provide a WYSIWYG editor when editing. No HTML validation is performed so be sure to pass the data passed in does not present a security threat.

dayDisplayStartHour.desc: Will scroll to a defined start hour when a day / multi-day component is rendered. Pass in the hour of the day from 0-23, the default being 7. Current has no effect on the CalendarAgenda component.
